meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound, as of a switch being operated or of two hard objects coming quickly into contact.
meanings.sent1: The light switch clicked when I turned it off.
meanings.sent2: I clicked my pen to start writing.
meanings.sent3: The door clicked shut behind me, making me jump.
meanings.sent4: Her heels clicked on the pavement as she walked away.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces clicked together perfectly, completing the picture.

meanings.definition: To select an item on a computer screen by pressing a button on a mouse or similar device.
meanings.sent1: I clicked on the link to open the webpage.
meanings.sent2: She clicked on the photo to view it in full size.
meanings.sent3: The cat clicked on the mouse pointer, thinking it was a bug.
meanings.sent4: His idea clicked with the team, and they decided to implement it.
meanings.sent5: The key clicked into place, unlocking the encrypted file.

meanings.definition: To quickly establish a positive connection or rapport with someone.
meanings.sent1: They clicked instantly and became good friends.
meanings.sent2: I clicked with my new coworker during our first meeting.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told really clicked with the audience, making them laugh.
meanings.sent4: Their personalities clicked like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The team clicked well together, achieving great success in their project.
